main event: A white object, described as larger than the morning star, was observed drifting slowly from the East to the Southeast in Klamath Falls, Oregon, on 8th May 1955. The observation lasted for over an hour, partly viewed through binoculars, and could not be positively identified as a balloon.
interesting points: The white object was observed for more than an hour and was described as larger than the morning star.
Part of the observation was made using binoculars, but the object could not be positively identified as a balloon.
The sighting was resolved as possibly a weather balloon due to wind, time, and proximity to the weather balloon releasing point.
The observation took place in Klamath Falls, Oregon, and was reported by a civilian Ground Observer Corps (GOC) observer.
The conclusion was that the sighting was 'unknown' with no further investigation.
sighted object: a white object larger than the morning star drifting slowly
